title: 109_hr1414
content: The Act may be cited as the "Extremely Hazardous Materials Transportation Security Act of 2005". Rulemaking is also addressed in the Act. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with various entities, must issue regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment regarding the shipping of extremely hazardous materials. The regulations aim to enhance physical security measures for such shipments. The regulations require the use of passive secondary containment for tanker valves and other technologies to ensure the integrity of pressurized tank cars transporting hazardous materials. It also mandates informing law enforcement authorities before transporting hazardous materials, creating terrorism response plans, and ensuring effective communication between transporters and entities. The regulations mandate comprehensive training for individuals involved in transporting extremely hazardous materials and responding to incidents involving such materials. The Secretary is tasked with determining the feasibility of transporting these materials through certain areas. The Secretary determines transportation routes for hazardous materials, with penalties for violations including civil actions and administrative penalties up to $100,000. The Secretary may issue an administrative penalty of up to $1,000,000 for noncompliance with hazardous materials regulations related to transportation. Before issuing the penalty, the person must be provided with written notice and the opportunity to request a hearing within 30 days. Regulations for administrative hearings may be established by the Secretary. Establishing procedures for administrative hearings and review of penalties issued under this subsection, including necessary deadlines. SEC. 3. WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION. Whistleblower protection for individuals involved in shipping extremely hazardous materials prohibits discrimination for reporting violations to regulatory agencies or Congress. The whistleblower protection law prohibits discrimination against individuals reporting violations related to the security of shipments of extremely hazardous materials to regulatory agencies, Congress, or persons with supervisory authority. It allows individuals to file complaints, testify, or refuse to violate laws without retaliation. A person alleging discharge or discrimination in violation of whistleblower protection laws can seek relief by filing a complaint with the Secretary of Labor or bringing an action in court for de novo review if no decision is made within 180 days. The procedure for such actions is outlined. An action under whistleblower protection laws shall follow rules in section 42121(b) of title 49, US Code, with notification to the person named in the complaint and their employer. Legal burdens of proof from the same section apply, and the action must be initiated within 90 days of the violation. In any action under whistleblower protection laws, a person prevailing in the action is entitled to remedies to make them whole, including reinstatement, back pay with interest, and compensation for damages. This section does not diminish the rights of any person. The curr_chunk states that it does not diminish the rights, privileges, or remedies of any person under any Federal or State law or collective bargaining agreement. SEC. 4. REPORT ON EXTREMELY HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TRANSPORTATION SECURITY. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a report to Congress within 180 days on the security and risk of terrorist attacks on shipments of extremely hazardous materials. The report will include information on responsible agencies, authorities, responsibilities, and infrastructure vulnerabilities related to the transportation of these materials. The report under subsection (a) must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines "extremely hazardous material" as toxic by inhalation, extremely flammable, highly explosive, or designated by the Secretary. "Area of concern" refers to an area of particular interest to terrorists.
